As we wrap up National School Choice Week, I was grateful for the opportunity to join Moms for Liberty today in Columbia to show support for #schoolchoice. I look forward to working with my colleagues in expanding school choice for generations to come.

Homeschooling has been critical to #schoolchoice during the pandemic. This Congress I introduced the Military Child Educational Freedom Act, to allow active-duty military to use an educational savings account on homeschooling their children.

Private schools are an important part of National School Choice Week. These schools may offer a unique curriculum, smaller class sizes, or a faith-based style of learning. #Schoolchoice means having options and opportunities!

Approximately 5 million students would attend a charter school today if they had the option. We must expand #schoolchoice. Grateful to lead a letter to appropriators every year supporting the Charter School Program.

I am grateful to be a Champion of Magnet School Excellence. The 2nd district has 22 magnet schools that focus on specialized curriculums, allowing students to grow in these fields. #Schoolchoice provides opportunities!

Grateful to be an original cosponsor of H.Res. 882, expressing support for designation of this week as National School Choice Week. I look forward to highlighting #schoolchoice and the impact it has on SC's Second District.
